customfonts.MyTextViewMSOT.android:text: 1.If there is work at the ceiling/ roof void, has technician check if there are electrical fittings/ cables at the ceiling space/ roof void?
2.If there are electrical cables/ fittings at the ceiling/ roof void, has staff discuss with customer to turn off the power to these electricals before start work?
3.If not practicable to shut down power to the electricals at the ceiling/ roof void, other safe alternatives have been adopted?
4.Electrical insulation gloves used by staff are in good condition?
5.Insect light traps are unplugged from the power point prior to servicing? (as per Pink Note 9).
6.High voltage electrical cabinet or room is clearly labelled (e.g. Danger - High Voltage), and securely enclosed.
7.Staff does not access and open any operating high voltage electrical panel.
8.A minimum safe distance of 3m is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding (e.g. hand phone) and any suspected or exposed live high voltage electrical part.
9.A minimum safe distance - Arms Length is maintained between staff’s body/ the conductive tool he is holding and any suspected or exposed live low voltage electrical part.
10.If electrical work is involved e.g. connecting, laying cables, it is done by qualified, licensed electrician. Take picture of the license if available.
